decks.notes: This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful spells that disrupt their game plan. The key strategy is to apply early pressure using cards like Voldaren Thrillseeker and Marvin, Murderous Mimic, while also disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The inclusion of cards like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower allows for removal of opposing threats, while maintaining a steady stream of damage. The deck's mana base is designed to support both the aggressive nature of the deck and its disruptive elements, providing flexibility and consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Transmogrify combo to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Hidetsugu Consumes All. It also includes disruptive cards like Fatal Push, Duress, and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra layer of consistency to the deck. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the combo pieces and ensure smooth gameplay. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures while disrupting their strategy.

This deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for powerful creatures and control enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes a variety of creatures with different abilities that can be searched for with Enigmatic Incarnation, along with enchantments to control the board. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra value. The deck also includes a mix of removal spells and lands to provide consistency and protection for its important pieces.

This Rakdos Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck also includes burn spells like Monstrous Rage and Titan's Strength to push through damage and finish off opponents quickly. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional flexibility and consistency to the deck. With a mix of creatures, burn spells, and a powerful companion choice, this deck is designed to apply constant pressure and secure victories in the Pioneer format.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize cheap spells and card draw effects to quickly fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes, bringing them back for repeated attacks and overwhelming the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and Brazen Borrower to control the board and protect your creatures. The inclusion of Picklock Prankster, Ledger Shredder, and Profit's Eidetic Memory helps to accelerate the deck's game plan and ensure a steady stream of threats. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan while also providing sufficient access to all colors needed.

This deck looks to quickly fill the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenixes for repeated attacks. The deck includes cheap spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability and dig through the deck for more resources. Ledger Shredder helps by both digging through the deck and enabling the Phoenix's return. This aggressive strategy aims to overwhelm the opponent with flying threats and burn spells for removal. The deck also includes counterspells to protect its key threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence with low-cost creatures like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, while disrupting the opponent with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. By utilizing cards like Collected Company to efficiently put creatures onto the battlefield, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and maintain pressure throughout the game. Additionally, cards like Skyclave Apparition help to deal with threats from the opponent, while cards like Werefox Bodyguard provide protection for key creatures. The deck is designed to be fast and relentless in dealing damage to the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while gradually building up resources and eventually overwhelming them with threats like Shark Typhoon and The Wandering Emperor. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides additional card advantage and control elements, while Horned Loch-Whale and March of Otherworldly Light offer powerful win conditions. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy while also providing flexibility and consistency. Overall, this deck excels at outlasting opponents and dominating the late game.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly getting Arclight Phoenix onto the battlefield by utilizing cheap spells and card draw. Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster help to get spells into the graveyard while also providing additional value. Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe serve as removal spells, with Spell Pierce for protection. Treasure Cruise provides card advantage, while Profit's Eidetic Memory helps to recur spells from the graveyard. Brazen Borrower offers tempo plays and disruption. The deck aims to be fast and efficient in bringing back Arclight Phoenix for repeated attacks.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a powerful board presence of Human creatures that can work together to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive attacks. Cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Adeline, Resplendent Cathar can boost the entire team, while creatures like Dauntless Bodyguard and Coppercoat Vanguard provide protection and resilience. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent's game plan. The mana base ensures smooth and consistent casting of spells to maintain pressure on the opponent.

The key concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, removal spells like Fatal Push and Heartless Act, and powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross. The deck also aims to outvalue the opponent with cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Bloodletter of Aclazotz. The mana base includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Castle Locthwain to provide additional advantages. Overall, the deck focuses on control elements to dominate the game and secure victory.

The key strategy of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, backed up by a mix of combat tricks and burn spells. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Callous Sell-Sword, along with pump spells like Titan's Strength and Monstrous Rage, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana acceleration to ensure a steady stream of threats. Cards like Fatal Push and Claim / Fame provide interaction and removal options when needed.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Transmogrify combo to cheat out powerful creatures like Valgavoth and Reckoner Bankbuster. The main goal is to disrupt opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, while controlling the board with removal spells such as Fatal Push and Torch the Tower. The deck also includes graveyard recursion and card advantage tools like Case of the Stashed Skeleton and Ob Nixilis, the Adversary. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and facilitate the combo strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing Transmogrify to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Reckoner Bankbuster. The deck also includes a variety of removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board. A key card in the deck is Case of the Stashed Skeleton, which can be used to search for creatures needed for the combo. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana acceleration. The deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This UW Control deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with card advantage, counterspells, and removal spells. The main goal is to control the game through a mix of disruption, card draw, and board wipes, eventually winning with a big threat like Shark Typhoon or Teferi, Hero of Dominaria. The deck also utilizes Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion for additional value and plays a high land count to ensure consistent mana production. By controlling the opponent's resources and dictating the pace of the game, this deck aims to grind out victory in the late game.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeated attacks. It utilizes cheap spells and efficient card draw to help ensure that Arclight Phoenix can be consistently recurred. The inclusion of other evasive threats like Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster helps maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also has some control elements like Spell Pierce and Lightning Axe to protect its threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the strategy is to be aggressive while maintaining card advantage and tempo.

The main idea of this Mono Black Control deck is to maintain control of the game by disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, while also removing threats with cards like Fatal Push and Sheoldred's Edict. The deck also aims to pressure the opponent with powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodletter of Aclazotz. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategy by providing consistent black mana sources and utility lands like Field of Ruin and Castle Locthwain. Overall, the deck focuses on control elements and efficient removal to outlast opponents.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize Enigmatic Incarnation to sacrifice creatures and search for powerful enchantments to control the game. The deck has a mix of creatures with different abilities and enchantments to disrupt the opponent's strategy. With the addition of Yorion as a companion, the deck can take advantage of blink effects to generate additional value and keep the opponent on the back foot. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the board and gaining incremental advantages through Enigmatic Incarnation, which allows you to sacrifice a creature to tutor for a higher-costed creature. By using this ability strategically, you can constantly improve your board state and disrupt your opponent's plans. The inclusion of Companions like Yorion, Sky Nomad adds additional value to your deck and provides versatility in gameplay. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to outvalue your opponent by utilizing powerful creatures and interactive spells to control the game.

This deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation to tutor for different powerful creatures and enchantments to control the game. The deck includes a variety of creatures with varying abilities and mana costs to provide flexibility in different situations. It also includes a mix of removal spells and support enchantments to deal with threats and disrupt opponents' strategies. The land base is carefully crafted to ensure mana consistency and access to different colors needed for the deck. The overall strategy is to outvalue and outlast opponents through efficient creature and enchantment interactions.

This deck focuses on utilizing Sacrifice mechanics to gain advantage over opponents with aggressive plays. By sacrificing creatures like Cauldron Familiar and using cards like Witch's Oven and Mayhem Devil, the deck aims to control the board and apply pressure through constant pings and damage. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds flexibility and consistency to the deck's strategy. With a mix of removal spells and key creatures, this Jund Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through efficient resource management and aggressive tactics.

The deck focuses on utilizing Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana quickly in order to cast powerful spells and combo off. Cards like Arboreal Grazer and Vizier of Tumbling Sands help ramp up mana production, while Hidden Strings and Pore Over the Pages provide card advantage and dig for combo pieces. The inclusion of Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience allows for game-winning plays and overwhelming advantages. The deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo pieces while maintaining control over the game with cards like Archdruid's Charm and Boseiju, Who Endures.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. The main strategy is to play low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Callous Sell-Sword to pressure the opponent early, while using spells like Monstrous Rage and Titan's Strength for additional damage. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Reckless Rage to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds additional mana flexibility to the deck.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with low-cost, aggressive creatures and various combat tricks to deal massive amounts of damage. The deck also includes a companion, Jegantha, the Wellspring, to provide additional support and versatility. The combination of creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Callous Sell-Sword with spells like Fatal Push and Infuriate allows the deck to maintain pressure on the opponent and finish them off swiftly. The use of dual lands like Blackcleave Cliffs and Blood Crypt ensures consistent mana production for the deck's fast-paced strategy.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on fast, aggressive creatures and burn spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The key strategy is to play small, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Kumano Faces Kakkazan early in the game, boosting them with combat tricks like Titan's Strength and Monstrous Rage to deal as much damage as possible. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds versatility and consistency to the deck's mana base. Overall, this deck aims to win the game within the first few turns through a combination of fast creatures and direct damage spells.

The deck revolves around stalling and controlling the game by denying the opponent's resources and disrupting their game plan. It focuses on generating card advantage, countering threats, board wipes, and lands destruction. The companion Kaheera, the Orphanguard adds additional value to the strategy. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through incremental advantages while dominating the late game with powerful spells and planeswalkers.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to stall the game with board wipes like Supreme Verdict and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, while generating card advantage with Memory Deluge and Omen of the Sea. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value through blinking permanents like Portable Hole and The Wandering Emperor. The deck also includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Deserted Beach to disrupt the opponent's mana base and resources.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards. It utilizes powerful control spells like Dovin's Veto and Supreme Verdict to maintain board control, while also leveraging card advantage with Memory Deluge and Narset, Parter of Veils. The inclusion of Kaheera as a companion adds an extra layer of synergy to the deck, providing additional creatures and value. The deck also includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Restless Anchorage to disrupt opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through efficient control strategies.

The main objective of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage, while also utilizing the blink effect of Yorion, Sky Nomad to generate incremental advantage. This deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, outvalue them with card advantage engines like Three Steps Ahead and Memory Deluge, and eventually win the game with a late-game bomb like Shark Typhoon or The Wandering Emperor. The land base provides color fixing and utility, supporting the control elements of the deck.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using removal spells and counterspells to deal with opponent threats, while also utilizing card draw and selection to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion gives added benefits to the deck, making the most out of creature spells. The deck's win condition revolves around a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils, along with board wipes like Supreme Verdict to control the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on quickly getting Arclight Phoenix into the graveyard and then utilizing cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to bring them back into play. The deck also includes card draw and filtering spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand to help find key cards and maintain momentum. Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster provide additional ways to trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability, while Brazen Borrower offers versatility and disruption. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, using a mix of burn spells and evasive threats to pressure the opponent and close out games quickly.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells in order to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeated attacks. The deck includes cards that help draw cards, filter through the deck, and protect the phoenixes once they hit the battlefield. The deck aims to be fast-paced and aggressive, utilizing the Phoenix's ability to return from the graveyard to overwhelm the opponent with flying threats. Additionally, the deck includes a mix of burn spells and counter magic to maintain control of the game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells, possibly using Ledger Shredder, and then bring back Arclight Phoenix to repeatedly attack and pressure the opponent. It also includes disruption in the form of picklock Prankster and Spell Pierce to protect its game plan. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive while also having ways to refill its hand with spells like Treasure Cruise and Fiery Impulse. It utilizes a mix of burn spells, card draw, and synergy with Arclight Phoenix to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

This deck revolves around rapidly filling up your graveyard with spells and then bringing back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard for repeated attacks. Using cheap spells and card draw to trigger Phoenix's ability, while also disrupting your opponent with counterspells and removal. The strategy is to overwhelm your opponent with fast, aggressive plays and maintain card advantage through cantrips and card draw effects. The mana base is optimized for consistent access to all colors and maximizing the chances of casting spells with high color requirements.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play Arclight Phoenix and other creatures like Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder to quickly deal damage to your opponent. This deck also utilizes spells like Lightning Axe, Fiery Impulse, and Opt to control the board and keep the pressure on. The inclusion of cards like Brazen Borrower and Spell Pierce helps to protect your creatures and disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and card advantage through spells like Consider, Sleight of Hand, and Treasure Cruise, allowing you to maintain a consistent flow of threats.

This deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with Arclight Phoenix to bring them back and deal damage to the opponent. It includes a mix of cheap spells and card draw to enable the Phoenix's ability. Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder help with graveyard manipulation, while cards like Lightning Axe and Fiery Impulse provide removal and control. The deck also includes a few versatile spells like Spell Pierce and Brazen Borrower for additional options. The land base is built to support the deck's mana needs and ensure consistency in play.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards, allowing for the quick and repetitive casting of Arclight Phoenix. By using efficient spells like Consider, Opt, and Fiery Impulse, alongside cards like Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster to enable Arclight Phoenix's ability, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of aggressive flyers. Additionally, the deck includes Treasure Cruise for card advantage and disruptive spells like Spell Pierce to protect its game plan. The mana base supports the deck's aggressive game plan while also providing flexibility in casting different spells.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard to deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cheap spells like Fiery Impulse and Lightning Axe to trigger the Phoenix's ability, while also filling the graveyard with spells to bring it back. Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder help with this strategy by milling cards and enabling more Phoenix casts. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and removal like Spikefield Hazard to control the board. Treasure Cruise provides card advantage to keep the aggression going. It aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, recurring threats.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board using discard spells and removal, while also utilizing creatures that provide additional value. The goal is to control the game by removing threats and gradually building up a board presence with powerful creatures that can quickly close out the game. The deck also includes land destruction elements to disrupt the opponent's mana base and disrupt their game plan. Overall, the key strategy is to outvalue and outlast the opponent through efficient removal, discard, and strong creatures.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Favored Hoplite, supported by pump spells like Defiant Strike and Ancestral Anger to deal damage efficiently. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana ramp options. The deck also includes removal spells like Spikefield Hazard and Reckless Rage to clear the way for attacks. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive creatures and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy focused on green mana devotion. By utilizing powerful green creatures and mana accelerators like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, the deck aims to quickly ramp up its mana production and flood the board with threats like Cavalier of Thorns and Old-Growth Troll. Supporting cards like Leyline of the Guildpact and Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner help to generate additional value and maintain tempo, while Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx enables explosive mana generation for big plays.

The deck focuses on using Enigmatic Incarnation as a key engine to tutor for powerful creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck includes a variety of high-impact creatures such as Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Elesh Norn, Mother of Machines, along with support cards like Fires of Invention and Portable Hole to maintain control of the game. The companion Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value and flexibility, making the deck a versatile and resilient control archetype in Pioneer 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on controlling the game using the Enigmatic Incarnation enchantment to continuously tutor for powerful creatures. By sacrificing smaller creatures to search for larger threats like Noxious Gearhulk and Elesh Norn, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and board presence. The use of Leyline Binding and Nowhere to Run helps to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while the inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value through blinking creatures for extra triggers. The deck is designed to outvalue and outlast opponents through its powerful creatures and control elements.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on building a strong board presence with creature tokens and efficient removal spells to control the board. It utilizes cards like Witch's Oven and Scavenger's Talent to generate value from sacrificing creatures and has a strong sacrifice theme with cards like Cauldron Familiar and Deadly Dispute. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds consistency to the deck's mana base. Overall, this deck aims to create an aggressive and resilient board state while disrupting the opponent's game plan with targeted removal spells.

The deck focuses on assembling and protecting the Greasefang Parhelion combo, utilizing cards like Overlord of the Balemurk and Raffine's Informant to search for key pieces. Cards like Bitter Triumph and Cache Grab help control the board and protect the combo. Thoughtseize and Say Its Name disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful threats like Altanak, the Thrice-Called and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse for additional pressure. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements and maximize consistency in pulling off the combo.

The deck focuses on assembling the Lotus Field combo as efficiently as possible, utilizing cards like Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings to untap Lotus Field and generate an abundance of mana. By utilizing cards like Pore Over the Pages and Archdruid's Charm, the deck aims to find key combo pieces and protect its win condition. With access to powerful cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Impulse, the deck has the ability to search for key combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan, ultimately leading to a decisive victory.

Utilizing a companion to maximize efficiency, this aggressive Rakdos deck focuses on early aggression and disruption with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. The deck also includes cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Tree of Perdition to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of key creatures like Marvin, Murderous Mimic and Voldaren Thrillseeker help to close out games quickly while maintaining board presence. With a mix of removal, disruption, and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory in Pioneer 1 vs 1 matches.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures and using burn spells to deal damage to the opponent's life total. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells, while utilizing Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion for additional value. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize or mount a defense. The inclusion of cards like Fatal Push, Thoughtseize, and Monstrous Rage helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan and keep the pressure up.

This deck focuses on building a fast and aggressive board presence with low-cost creatures and pump spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It makes use of the companion card Jegantha, the Wellspring for additional mana ramp and card advantage. The deck includes a mix of creatures with haste and abilities that can deal direct damage, as well as efficient removal spells to control the board. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle, with a mix of fast lands, shock lands, and utility lands to provide consistency and flexibility in play.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost, aggressive creatures to quickly deal damage to the opponent. With a mix of efficient creatures and burn spells, the deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game before they can stabilize. Jegantha, the Wellspring provides an additional resource for mana acceleration while also being a potential game finisher. The inclusion of cards like Monstrous Rage and Titan's Strength further enhances the deck's ability to push through damage and overwhelm the opponent. The mana base is built to support both the aggressive nature of the deck and the companion requirement.

The deck focuses on utilizing the interaction between creatures and mana producers to generate consistent value and disrupt opponents with the help of Collected Company. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a powerful companion that enables additional mana acceleration. The deck includes a mix of creatures with various abilities, as well as lands that support the strategy. By combining these elements effectively, the deck aims to create overwhelming board presence and establish control over the game.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with mana dorks like Elvish Mystic and Llanowar Elves, allowing for explosive starts. The deck then utilizes cards like Righteous Valkyrie, Bishop of Wings, and Resplendent Angel to gain life and create powerful flying threats. Collected Company is used to refill the board and push for the final damage, while Skyclave Apparition deals with opponent's threats. The key idea is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, backed up by lifegain and powerful creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to field a fast-paced aggressive strategy with efficient creatures and disruptive elements in the form of Archon of Emeria and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben. Utilizing cards like Skyclave Apparition and Collected Company, the deck aims to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Kellan, Daring Traveler and Werefox Bodyguard provides additional flexibility and resilience to face various threats. The deck also incorporates a land base that supports the aggressive game plan while providing enough mana sources for consistent plays.

The main idea of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of cheap creatures and disrupt their game plan with cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Archon of Emeria. The deck also focuses on generating value through cards like Skyclave Apparition and Aven Interrupter, while maintaining a strong board presence. With the help of cards like Collected Company, the deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

This Selesnya Aggro deck focuses on deploying efficient and disruptive creatures quickly to pressure opponents and maintain board control. By utilizing cards like Aven Interrupter, Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, and Skyclave Apparition, the deck aims to limit the opponent's options and establish a dominant board presence. Collected Company adds card advantage and enables explosive turns, while cards like Voice of Resurgence and Archon of Emeria punish opponents for playing noncreature spells. With a mix of early aggression and powerful mid-game threats, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory through consistent pressure.

The deck focuses on utilizing low-cost Spirit creatures with flying to quickly apply pressure on the opponent. By using cards like Rattlechains and Spell Queller to disrupt the opponent's game plan, and cards like Spectral Sailor and Supreme Phantom to boost the Spirit creatures' power, the deck aims to maintain a strong board presence while controlling the game. The addition of cards like Enduring Curiosity and Geistlight Snare provide additional card advantage and removal options. The deck's mana base is constructed to provide consistent access to the necessary colors and mana sources.

This deck focuses on using the Transmogrify combo to turn your creature tokens into powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces, disrupt your opponent's strategy with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize, and control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Torch the Tower. Jegantha, the Wellspring serves as a companion to provide additional value. With a mix of control elements and powerful creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm and outmaneuver your opponent in a Pioneer 1 vs 1 setting.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells to counter opponent's threats and maintain board control. The deck includes a companion Yorion, Sky Nomad for additional value and plays a mix of counterspells like Dovin's Veto and board wipes like Supreme Verdict to sweep the battlefield. It also includes card draw options like Omen of the Sea and Memory Deluge to maintain card advantage. The deck's win condition is to control the game until it can close out with powerful finishers like Shark Typhoon and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counter spells, card draw, and removal. It aims to slow down the opponent's game plan while establishing a solid board presence with creatures like The Wandering Emperor and Horned Loch-Whale. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides card advantage and disruption, while Shark Typhoon creates threats while cycling. Strict Proctor helps in shutting down opponent's key plays, and March of Otherworldly Light can be a finisher. The mana base is designed to provide consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's moves through counterspells, board wipes, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria to disrupt the opponent's strategy while keeping card advantage with Memory Deluge and The Wandering Emperor. The deck also includes cards like Deduce and Get Lost for additional disruption and tempo plays. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure consistent color access for the various spells in the deck. This archetype aims to out-value and outlast the opponent through careful decision-making and resource management.

This UW control deck focuses on using a variety of spells and creatures to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With Yorion as the companion, the deck can generate value by blinking permanents like Omen of the Sea and The Wandering Emperor. The deck includes counterspells like Dovin's Veto and board wipes like Supreme Verdict to maintain control. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Narset, Parter of Veils provide card advantage and disruption. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to blue and white mana sources.

The main strategy of this UW Control deck is to control the board by using removal spells like Portable Hole and No More Lies, countermagic like Dovin's Veto, and board wipes like Supreme Verdict. The deck also includes card draw with Memory Deluge and ways to manipulate the library with Deduce and Three Steps Ahead. Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provide additional card advantage and control, while The Wandering Emperor serves as a win condition. The mana base includes utility lands like Field of Ruin and Restless Anchorage to outvalue the opponent and secure the win.

This deck focuses on casting spells quickly and efficiently to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard and dealing damage to the opponent. With a combination of low-cost spells and card draw engines like Treasure Cruise, the goal is to flood the board with spells, trigger Arclight Phoenix's ability, and create a steady stream of damage. With cards like Picklock Prankster and Ledger Shredder to help enable this strategy, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures to secure victory.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix for repeated attacks. Using cheap spells like Opt, Lightning Axe, and Fiery Impulse, along with card draw from Treasure Cruise and Consider, players aim to quickly bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. The addition of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds versatility to the deck, allowing for additional mana ramp and late-game plays. The deck also includes control elements like Spell Pierce and Stern Dismissal to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cheap spells and then bring back the powerful Arclight Phoenix repeatedly to deal damage to the opponent. The deck aims to be aggressive and use cards like Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster to enable the Phoenix's revival. Several card draw spells are included to help dig for key pieces, while a small amount of disruption and protection in the form of Brazen Borrower, Spell Pierce, and Fiery Impulse help to keep the opponent on their toes. The land base is configured to provide the right colors of mana efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells and then bringing back Arclight Phoenix to attack aggressively. It includes low-cost spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability, along with cards like Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster for additional value. With a combination of card draw and disruption, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its fast-paced gameplay and efficient removal spells. The inclusion of Treasure Cruise helps maintain card advantage and keep the pressure on throughout the game.

This deck focuses on using cheap spells to quickly fill the graveyard with Arclight Phoenixes and then bring them back to the battlefield for repeated attacks. The deck includes various card draw and selection spells to dig through the deck quickly and find the needed pieces. Ledger Shredder and Picklock Prankster help disrupt the opponent's game plan while also enabling the Phoenix strategy. The deck aims to close out games quickly by overwhelming the opponent with flying, hasty threats.

Mono Black Control focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through targeted discard spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, while efficiently removing threats from the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat. The deck also aims to generate card advantage with Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber and Liliana of the Veil, while closing out the game with powerful finishers like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred's Edict. By denying the opponent resources and controlling the board, Mono Black Control looks to grind out victories over the course of a game.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan by stripping their hand of key cards using spells like Thoughtseize and Duress, while controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Graveyard Trespasser. The deck also utilizes powerful creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodletter of Aclazotz to apply pressure and close out the game. With a mix of disruption, removal, and threats, this deck aims to outlast opponents and grind out victories through attrition.

This mono black control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize while also controlling the game with removal spells like Fatal Push. The creatures in the deck are powerful threats, including Archfiend of the Dross and Bloodletter of Aclazotz. The deck also has a strong mana base with utility lands like Castle Locthwain and Field of Ruin. The goal of the deck is to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of disruption, removal, and powerful creatures.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing powerful creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm opponents. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures like The Wandering Emperor and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, along with removal spells like Torch the Tower and March of Otherworldly Light to control the board. With a solid mana base and a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Indomitable Creativity card to turn artifacts into larger threats, such as Vaultborn Tyrant or Hullbreaker Horror. The deck aims to control the board with counter spells like Spell Pierce and Negate, while also using burn spells like Fiery Impulse and Volcanic Spite to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation with Dig Through Time and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker, as well as land disruption with cards like Jwari Disruption. Overall, the deck focuses on combining creative strategies with powerful combo plays.

The creatures in this deck benefit from mill effects and boost each other's power, creating a strong aggressive strategy. The inclusion of Kaito, Bane of Nightmares adds a powerful finisher to the deck, while Faerie Mastermind provides additional card advantage. The deck also utilizes a mix of dual lands to ensure consistent mana production and maximize the efficiency of its spells and abilities.

The deck also aims to control the battlefield with Sheoldred's Edict and Shark Typhoon and maintain a strong mana base with various dual lands. The goal is to outlast opponents by controlling the game tempo and resource advantage, ultimately leading to victory through attrition.

It aims to outvalue opponents by constantly upgrading its threats and disrupting their game plan with a mix of removal and enchantments. The deck has a toolbox approach, able to adapt to different situations by tutoring for the most suitable creature at any given time. With a mix of threats and disruption, it seeks to overwhelm opponents and come out ahead in the late game.

The main strategy of this deck is to quickly assemble the Greasefang Parhelion combo, which involves using cards like Raffine's Informant and Overlord of the Balemurk to generate additional mana and card advantage. The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Lotus Field and other cards to generate massive amounts of mana and overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and abilities. The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with cards like Lotus Cobra and Nissa, Resurgent Animist, while also utilizing control elements like Fatal Push and Memory Deluge to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Lumra, Bellow of the Woods and Aftermath Analyst adds additional value and flexibility to the deck's overall strategy.  The land base is carefully constructed to support the combo potential of Lotus Field.

This deck aims to quickly ramp into Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana, allowing the player to cast powerful spells and combo off for a win condition. Using cards like Archdruid's Charm and Hidden Strings to untap Lotus Field, combined with Vizier of Tumbling Sands for additional untaps, the deck can generate a huge amount of mana in one turn. This allows for casting big spells like Emergent Ultimatum and Omniscience to take over the game and win in a single turn. The deck also includes protection with cards like Lier, Disciple of the Drowned and Boseiju, Who Endures.

The deck revolves around using Lotus Field to generate a large amount of mana and then using various cards like Vizier of Tumbling Sands and Hidden Strings to untap the Lotus Field multiple times in a turn. This allows the player to cast powerful spells like Omniscience and Emergent Ultimatum to gain a significant advantage over their opponent. The deck also utilizes cards like Strict Proctor to protect their combo pieces and Boseiju, Who Endures to ensure key spells resolve successfully. Overall, the strategy focuses on quickly setting up a powerful board state and overwhelming the opponent with efficient spells.
